intro: Thlaspi salticola, commonly known as the saltbush buttercup, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compact, succulent-like leaves that help it retain water in harsh conditions. Thlaspi salticola is often found in coastal areas, salt flats, and dry soils where it thrives despite high salinity. Its ability to tolerate extreme environments makes it an important species in ecological studies of halophytes.
